adr_address: Piazza Giuseppe Missori, 1, 20123 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Premium hotel offering Wi-Fi & a breakfast buffet, plus an Italian restaurant & a bar.

formatted_address: Piazza Giuseppe Missori, 1, 20123 Milano MI, Italy
name: Hotel dei Cavalieri Milano Duomo

plus_code.compound_code: F56Q+9F Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text: Really lovely modern hotel. Very central to the cathedral and shopping/eating areas. Roof top terrace has fantastic views, reasonably priced with bar snacks included. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was amazing really good selection of hot and cold foods available. Air conditioning was available in the lobby and the breakfast room. Our room suggests we had air conditioning, we didn't. The temperature dial on the wall only had an option to be turned down to 5C and there was no air conditioning option. It was 36C outside over the three days we stayed. The cleaners kept leaving the curtains open allowing the heat of the sun to come through. With no air con and these factors our room was consistently hot and was uncomfortable at night when sleeping. This was unfortunate as the hotel overall is fantastic. If the air con had been working efficiently I would have given the overall score as a 5.

We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Dei Cavalieri Milano Duomo. The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable, and the room service was excellent. It’s also a kid-friendly hotel, which made traveling with our little one much easier. While they don’t provide a microwave or kettle in the rooms, the staff were very accommodating and always helped us warm baby food and milk whenever needed.

A special mention to Anna at the reception – she was truly outstanding. Anna was extremely professional, welcoming, and attentive, which made our check-in experience smooth and pleasant. Compared to some other receptionists who came across as dismissive, especially towards Indian guests, Anna stood out for her warmth and respect. She represented the hotel in the best way possible and set the tone for a great stay.

Overall, we highly recommend this hotel, especially for families, and we are grateful for Anna’s excellent hospitality.

When we first got to the hotel and checked in our room, the room was a disaster - very old and small! We asked for a room change in the renovated section but the receptionists were not helpful at all! But thanks to Alexandra who truly made our experience unforgettable by giving us one of the best rooms in the hotel. Our stay was made absolutely perfect thanks to her! She was incredibly kind, helpful, and attentive. She went out of her way to ensure we had everything we needed. She left such a positive impact on our trip! Alexandra is a real asset to the hotel, and we’re so grateful for everything she did to make our stay so special. Thank you, Alexandra!

This was my first hotel experience in Milan, even though it's my third time visiting the city. The room was very spacious — thanks to the helpful hotel staff. There was plenty of space, which we really appreciated. The breakfast offered a wide variety of options, and as Turks — known for loving and making the best breakfasts — we truly enjoyed it! The hotel is just a 5-minute walk from the Duomo, making it super convenient. The rooftop restaurant was a chic and amazing place to enjoy a drink with a view. I really hope I’ll stay here again the next time I come to Milan — inshallah!

The area is really close to the dome and the staff at the reception and the breakfast room was very friendly and attentive.

The bathroom was completely worn down and very small. There was mould on the ceiling and walls. Therefore the room rate didn't match what we experienced.
The interior of the room was worn down as well, old, used, burn stained,... The view from the rooftop was nice but prices were over the top...
